content: Hello Jeyachandran, thank you for coming in today. I'm Master, the hiring manager for the Software Engineer position at Google. Let's get started with the interview. Can you start by telling me about your background and why you're interested in this role?
i am a full stack developer

That's impressive! With expertise in both frontend and backend development, you've got a solid foundation in software engineering. Can you walk me through your experience with React.js, Node.js, and React Native in your role at Fabromant? What kind of projects did you work on and what problems did you solve?
i worked the event management using react and node and mongodb
i worked the event management using react and node and mongodb

That sounds like an interesting project! How did you handle the backend API integration with MongoDB and Node.js? Were there any challenges you faced while working on that project, and how did you overcome them?
i have managed to build react app usig components
Can you tell me more about the components you built for the React app? Which ones were the most challenging to implement and how did you optimize their performance?
i used product cards as components and reused it many times effectively
That's a great example of reusing components effectively. Did you take care of handling various states and props for the product cards, such as loading, error, and data rendering?
yes usestate and useeffect and props in my application

State management and optimization are critical aspects of building scalable and maintainable front-end applications. It's great to hear that you used useState and useEffect effectively in your application. Props are also essential for passing data from parent to child components. Do you have any experience with Flux or Redux architectures for managing global state in larger applications?
